cards.definition: Unconscious protective behaviors that aim to reduce anxiety (e.g., Projection, Rationalization, Displacement).

cards.definition: Feelings of inferiority in childhood drive people to attempt to gain superiority.

cards.term: Feelings of inferiority in childhood drive people to attempt to gain superiority.

cards.definition: A universal version of the personal unconscious, holding mental patterns or memory traces common to all of us (archetypes).

cards.definition: Ancestral memories represented by universal themes in various cultures (e.g., the hero, the maiden).

cards.definition: Moving toward people (affiliation), Moving against people (aggression), Moving away from people (detachment).

cards.definition: Cognitive processes, behavior, and context all interact and influence each other simultaneously.

cards.definition: State of being in which our thoughts about our real self and ideal self are very similar.

cards.term: State of being in which our thoughts about our real self and ideal self are very similar.
